name: Acne
introduction: Acne, most commonly known as acne vulgaris, is a condition in which whiteheads, blackheads, and pimples appear on your skin. Mostly they occur on your face. However, they can also occur on your back, shoulders, arms, and chest. It occurs mostly in teenagers but can also affect people of other age groups. For treatment, mostly topical ones help in getting rid of it. Also, it may get better once the triggers are removed. Acne can also leave marks and scars on your skin if you treat them harshly. However, if you remain gentle to them, do not press them, they may go away on their own. Acne occurs mostly due to the clogging of pores due to dust, dirt, or bacteria. It can be accompanied by whiteheads, blackheads, and pimples.
subline: If you have a complaint of acne, visit the dermatologist. Side by side with the medical treatment, you can also try home remedies that can help you to get rid of it by balancing the pH and oils of your skin.

symptoms.des: The symptoms of acne may vary from person to person. For some, they may be severe, while for some, they are not. Acne vulgaris may show the following signs and symptoms
points: Nodules - large solid pus-filled lumps under the skin
Cystic lesions - painful lumps filled with pus under the skin

risk_factors: Hormonal changes
Excess oil production
Clogged pores
Bacterial infection
Poor diet or stress

worse_factors.description: Stress can worsen acne but does not directly cause it.

Androgens surge in boys and girls at puberty, which eventually leads to increased sebum production, may cause acne. Therefore, it is common in teenagers. Furthermore, in women it may also occur due to contraceptive use or pregnancy as they alter the hormone levels.
Processed foods and high-fat diets can contribute to worsening acne.
Certain medications like corticosteroids, lithium, or hormonal drugs can worsen or exacerbate acne.

treatment: Aloe Vera Gel - Apply directly to soothe and reduce inflammation.
Tea Tree Oil - Mix with carrier oil and apply for antibacterial benefits.
Honey and Cinnamon Mask - Apply as an antimicrobial treatment.
Green Tea - Use as a toner to reduce sebum production.

faqs.question: What is acne meaning in Urdu?
faqs.answer: Acne meaning in Urdu is Mahasey (مہاسے).

faqs.question: What is the main cause of acne?
faqs.answer: The main cause of acne is a surge in hormones called androgens...

faqs.question: How do I remove acne?
faqs.answer: There are several ways to remove acne, depending on its severity...

name: Pimple
introduction: A Pimple is a small papule or pustule that develops when sebaceous glands or oil glands become clogged and infected, eventually leading to red lesions filled with pus. If pimples occur repeatedly for a long time, the condition is called acne- most commonly known as acne vulgaris, is a condition in which whiteheads, blackheads, and pimples appear on your skin.
subline: Pimple mostly occur on your face. However, they can also occur on your back, shoulders, arms, and chest. It occurs mostly in teenagers but can also affect people of other age groups. For treatment, mostly topical antibacterials help. Also, it may get better once the triggers are removed. Pimples can also leave marks and scars on your skin if you treat them harshly. However, if you remain gentle to them, do not press them, they may go away on their own. It occurs mostly due to the clogging of pores due to dust, dirt, or bacteria. Pimples can be accompanied by whiteheads, blackheads, and pustules.

symptoms.des: Pimples, when occurring for a long time, can be called acne. The symptoms of acne may vary from person to person. For some, they may be severe, while for some, they are not. Acne vulgaris may show the following signs and symptoms
points: Nodules - large solid pus-filled lumps under the skin
Cystic lesions - painful lumps filled with pus under the skin

risk_factors: The main causes for pimples are
Hair follicles that are clogged by oil and dead skin cells
Clogged pores
Bacterial infection
Inflammation due to various reasons

worse_factors.description: Stress can worsen acne but does not directly cause it.

Androgens surge in boys and girls at puberty, which eventually leads to increased sebum production, may cause acne. Therefore, it is common in teenagers. Furthermore, in women it may also occur due to contraceptive use or pregnancy as they alter the hormone levels.
Processed foods and high-fat diets can contribute to worsening acne.
Certain medications like corticosteroids, lithium, or hormonal drugs can worsen or exacerbate acne.

treatment: Pimples are the most common skin problem people report to dermatologists. To keep your skin free from it, follow these tips
Aloe Vera Gel - Apply directly to soothe and reduce inflammation.
Tea Tree Oil - Mix with carrier oil and apply for antibacterial benefits.
Honey and Cinnamon Mask - Apply as an antimicrobial treatment.
Green Tea - Use as a toner to reduce sebum production.
Do not touch your pimples and face with dirty hands.
Before touching your face, wash your hands.
Do not eat oily fried foods.
Eat a diet rich in antioxidants like fruits, vegetables, and nuts.
Do not squeeze your pimples.
Keep yourself hydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 glasses of water in a day.

faqs.question: What is pimple meaning in Urdu?
faqs.answer: pimple meaning in Urdu is Mahasey (مہاسے).

faqs.question: What is the main cause of pimple?
faqs.answer: The main cause of pimple is a surge in hormones called androgens...

faqs.question: How do I remove pimple?
faqs.answer: There are several ways to remove pimple, depending on its severity...

name: Melasma
introduction: Melasma is a common skin condition that causes dark, discolored patches, usually on the face. It is often referred to as the mask of pregnancy because it frequently affects pregnant women. Melasma occurs due to an overproduction of melanin, the pigment responsible for skin color. It is not harmful but can be a cosmetic concern for many individuals.

symptoms.des: Melasma appears as brown, gray-brown, or tan patches on the skin, particularly in sun-exposed areas. Common locations include:
points: Nodules - large solid pus-filled lumps under the skin
Cystic lesions - painful lumps filled with pus under the skin

risk_factors: Hormonal Changes - Hormone replacement therapy (HRT)
Sun Exposure - UV rays stimulate excess melanin production.
Skin Type - More common in medium to dark skin tones
Genetics- If a close family member has melasma, you are more likely to develop it.

worse_factors.description: UV rays can darken existing patches.
Prolonged heat (e.g., cooking, saunas) can worsen melasma.
Pregnancy, menopause, or birth control pills can trigger melasma.
Harsh skincare products may cause irritation, leading to increased pigmentation.

treatment: Aloe Vera Gel - Aloe vera is rich in aloesin, a natural compound that inhibits melanin production. Applying fresh aloe vera gel on melasma-affected areas can help lighten dark patches, hydrate the skin, and promote healing. For best results, apply aloe vera gel before bedtime and leave it overnight.

Turmeric - Turmeric contains curcumin, a potent antioxidant with skin-brightening properties. It helps reduce pigmentation, inflammation, and oxidative stress. A turmeric and milk paste applied to the affected areas for 15 minutes daily can gradually lighten melasma patches.

Licorice Root- Licorice extract has glabridin, which prevents excess melanin production and helps fade dark spots. Applying licorice-infused oil or a face mask made with licorice powder and honey can naturally brighten the skin.

Sandalwood Powder- Sandalwood has cooling and anti-inflammatory properties that help soothe irritated skin and reduce dark patches. A sandalwood and rose water paste applied twice a week can give the skin a natural glow and lighten melasma over time.

Apple Cider Vinegar (ACV) - ACV contains acetic acid, which acts as a natural skin-lightening agent. Diluting ACV with water and using it as a toner helps balance skin pH, remove dead skin cells, and fade melasma spots.

faqs.question: Can melasma go away on its own?
faqs.answer: In some cases, especially pregnancy-related melasma, it may fade after childbirth. However, without proper treatment, it can persist for years.

faqs.question: Is melasma a permanent condition?
faqs.answer: Melasma can be managed but may not be completely cured. Proper skincare, sun protection, and treatments can keep it under control.

faqs.question: How long does it take for melasma to fade?
faqs.answer: With consistent treatment, melasma may lighten in 3 to 6 months, but deeper melasma may take longer.

faqs.question: What foods can help reduce melasma?
faqs.answer: Vitamin C-rich foods (citrus fruits, berries),Antioxidant-rich foods (green tea, nuts),Turmeric and ginger (anti-inflammatory benefits)

name: Eczema
introduction: Eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is an inflammatory condition that turns your skin red and itchy. In some people, it may even cover large patches of the body. However, they may heal and get back to normal. It is a long term, life long condition with no such cure. The attacks may flare up and settle over time. However, symptoms can be managed with supportive treatment. Also, some lifestyle habits can help in coping up with the disease. It may be accompanied by other inflammatory conditions like asthma and hay fever.
subline: However, it is not contagious. It does not spread through touch because it occurs due to an abnormality in your immune system, rather than an attack of a parasite.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of eczema may differ from person to person and level of inflammation. In some, it may affect large patches, while in some, it may only cover little patches. The signs and symptoms of eczema are:
points: Red or brown skin that most usually attacks the hands, feet, ankles, wrists, neck, upper chest, eyelids, inside the bend of the elbows and knees, and in infants, the face and scalp
Small red bumps that may leak fluid upon stretching

risk_factors: Genetic Factors-A family history of eczema, asthma, or hay fever (atopic conditions) increases the risk,Mutations in the filaggrin gene can weaken the skin barrier, making it prone to irritation and dryness.
Immune System Dysfunction - An overactive immune system can react aggressively to irritants and allergens, triggering inflammation and eczema flare-ups.
Skin Irritants- Harsh soaps, detergents, and skincare products can strip the skin of moisture and trigger irritation,Fragrances, dyes, and preservatives in cosmetics may also contribute to flare-ups.

Food Allergies & Sensitivities- Certain foods, such as dairy, eggs, nuts, soy, and gluten, may trigger eczema in some individuals and Histamine-rich foods (like tomatoes, citrus fruits, and processed foods) can worsen inflammation.

worse_factors.description: Eczema, asthma, and hay fever are related to each other in that they are inflammatory diseases. If inflammation due to eczema worsens, it can result in asthma and hay fever too. Therefore, many children having eczema have asthma and hay fever too.

Neurodermatitis is a condition in which raised rough patches of skin occur due to chronic itching and scaly skin. Eczema, when worsen, can lead to neurodermatitis. The patch becomes worse because you keep scratching it because of severe itch and prolonged habit.
Eczema leads to itching and eventually scratching, leading to cracks and breaks in your skin. Which eventually increases the risk of getting a bacterial, viral, or fungal infection of the skin.
Eczema can interfere with your sleep cycle as it causes a constant itch. However, if you apply the medications on time, the itch can be reduced which can help in sleeping better.

treatment: Keep your skin moisturized. Make sure you apply a cream or moisturizer that is gentle to your skin and keeps your skin hydrated. Since dry skin exacerbates eczema, keeping it moisturized eventually helps in lowering its exacerbations. You can also apply oils like olive oil or coconut oil that keeps it moisturized for long times.
Identify the triggers that worsen your eczema attack and try to avoid them. They can be anything like any particular kind of soap, lotion, stress, obesity, or dust.
Take baths for a short time and use warm water instead of hot. Using hot water turns your skin dry and flaky, eventually exacerbating an eczema attack.

faqs.question: What is eczema?
faqs.answer: Eczema (atopic dermatitis) is a chronic skin condition that causes red, itchy, dry, and inflamed skin. It can occur at any age but is most common in infants and young children.

faqs.question: What causes eczema?
faqs.answer: Eczema is caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. It occurs due to an overactive immune response and a weakened skin barrier, which makes the skin more sensitive to irritants, allergens, and environmental triggers.

faqs.question: Is eczema contagious?
faqs.answer: No, eczema is not contagious. You cannot catch eczema from another person, but it can run in families.

faqs.question: Does eczema go away on its own?
faqs.answer: Eczema is a chronic condition that may improve or worsen over time. Some children outgrow it, but for many, it persists into adulthood. Proper management and skincare can help control symptoms.

faqs.question: Can I use natural remedies for eczema?
faqs.answer: Aloe vera gel (soothing and anti-inflammatory),Coconut oil (moisturizing and antibacterial),Oatmeal baths (relieves itching and irritation),Turmeric paste (anti-inflammatory properties)

name: Hyper-Pigmentation
introduction: Hyperpigmentation is a common skin condition in which certain areas of the skin become darker than the surrounding skin. This occurs due to an excess production of melanin, the pigment responsible for skin color. It can affect people of all skin types and is usually harmless, but it may be a cosmetic concern for some individuals.

symptoms.des: Hyperpigmentation can be caused by sun exposure, hormonal changes, inflammation, and skin injuries. Proper skincare, herbal remedies, and lifestyle changes can help in managing and reducing hyperpigmentation effectively.
points: Dark patches or spots on the skin, usually brown, black, or grayish.
Uneven skin tone, making some areas appear darker.
No physical pain, but may cause emotional distress due to cosmetic concerns.
Spots may increase in size or become darker with time, especially with sun exposure.

risk_factors: Excessive Sun Exposure - UV rays stimulate melanin production, leading to dark patches.
Hormonal Changes - Pregnancy, menopause, and birth control pills can trigger melasma.
Skin Injuries & Inflammation - Acne scars, burns, or eczema can cause post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation.
Genetics - Family history of hyperpigmentation increases the risk.
Medications - Some drugs, such as antibiotics, chemotherapy, and anti-seizure medications, can cause pigmentation changes.
Aging - Older individuals are more prone to age spots and uneven skin tone.
Stress - High stress levels can increase cortisol, which may contribute to pigmentation issues.

worse_factors.description: UV rays increase melanin production.
Pregnancy and birth control pills can trigger or worsen melasma.
High temperatures can cause skin inflammation, making melasma worse.
Using strong exfoliants, alcohol-based toners, or irritating creams can aggravate Hyper-pigmentation

treatment: Aloe Vera Gel - Aloe vera is rich in aloesin, a natural compound that inhibits melanin production. Applying fresh aloe vera gel on melasma-affected areas can help lighten dark patches, hydrate the skin, and promote healing. For best results, apply aloe vera gel before bedtime and leave it overnight.

Turmeric - Turmeric contains curcumin, a potent antioxidant with skin-brightening properties. It helps reduce pigmentation, inflammation, and oxidative stress. A turmeric and milk paste applied to the affected areas for 15 minutes daily can gradually lighten melasma patches.

Licorice Root- Licorice extract has glabridin, which prevents excess melanin production and helps fade dark spots. Applying licorice-infused oil or a face mask made with licorice powder and honey can naturally brighten the skin.

Sandalwood Powder- Sandalwood has cooling and anti-inflammatory properties that help soothe irritated skin and reduce dark patches. A sandalwood and rose water paste applied twice a week can give the skin a natural glow and lighten melasma over time.

Apple Cider Vinegar (ACV) - ACV contains acetic acid, which acts as a natural skin-lightening agent. Diluting ACV with water and using it as a toner helps balance skin pH, remove dead skin cells, and fade melasma spots.

faqs.question: What is eczema?
faqs.answer: Eczema (atopic dermatitis) is a chronic skin condition that causes red, itchy, dry, and inflamed skin. It can occur at any age but is most common in infants and young children.

faqs.question: What is the main cause of hyperpigmentation?
faqs.answer: Hyperpigmentation is mainly caused by excess melanin production, which can be triggered by sun exposure, hormonal changes, inflammation, and aging.

faqs.question: Is hyperpigmentation permanent?
faqs.answer: In many cases, hyperpigmentation can fade with time if properly treated. However, some deep pigmentation (like dermal melasma) may take longer to improve or may not completely disappear.

faqs.question: Can hyperpigmentation come back after treatment?
faqs.answer: Yes, without proper sun protection and skincare, pigmentation can return. It's essential to use sunscreen daily and follow a consistent skincare routine.

faqs.question: What is the best natural remedy for hyperpigmentation?
faqs.answer: A combination of aloe vera, turmeric, licorice root, and green tea can help naturally reduce hyperpigmentation over time.

name: Dermatomyositis
introduction: Dermatomyositis is an inflammatory myopathy condition that occurs with a rash. It is a rare disease that causes muscle weakness due to inflammatory response. The exact cause of dermatomyositis is unknown, but it has similarities to autoimmune diseases.

symptoms.des: The common symptoms of it are distinctive skin rash, muscle weakness, and inflammatory myopathy, or inflamed muscles. It can affect both children and adults. In children, it occurs mostly during the age of 5 to 15. Until now, there is no such cure for it. But it can be managed through symptomatic treatment that can help regain muscle strength, muscle function and help clear rashes too.The most common signs and symptoms of dermatomyositis are;
points: The distinctive sign of dermatomyositis is an itchy rash, violet in color, or red dusky. It usually appears on the face, eyelids, knuckles, chest, back, elbows, or knees. Along with rashes, it causes progressive muscle weakness, which usually involves the muscles that are nearest to the trunk like the ones of your hips, thighs, shoulders, upper arms, and neck. The muscle weakness is progressive, which means it increases with time and involves more areas. Moreover, it involves both sides of your body, right and left both and worsens over time.
hard calcium deposits underneath the skin that mostly occur in children

risk_factors: Dermatomyositis can attack anyone, but according to experts it mostly attacks children aged between 5 and 15 and adults aged between 40 to 60. Moreover, it can also occur in people having a compromised immune system, like those who are taking corticosteroids (immunosuppressants) for a long time or those who have had a viral infection recently.
Environmental factors like sun exposure
Certain medications
Smoking

worse_factors.description: Dermatomyositis can affect the muscles of the esophagus, which makes it difficult to swallow food. Due to this, the person can not eat properly and weight loss occurs eventually.

Dermatomyositis can affect the muscles of the esophagus which makes it difficult to swallow the food. Due to this, the person can inhale food, leading to aspiration pneumonia. It occurs when the food enters your lungs along with the breath. Aspiration pneumonia can be a difficult situation to deal with at times.
If dermatomyositis affects your chest muscles, it can make breathing difficult for you.
Dermatomyositis can cause calcium to deposit underneath your skin. This tendency is more common in children as compared to adults.

treatment: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb Take Ashwagandha powder (1 tsp in warm milk or water) daily or use Ashwagandha
Coconut oil is a natural moisturizer with anti-inflammatory properties. Gently massage extra virgin coconut oil into the skin or use it for muscle relief.

Licorice root contains glycyrrhizin, which has anti-inflammatory and immune-modulating properties. Take licorice root tea once daily or use licorice-infused creams on the skin (consult with a healthcare provider for proper dosage).

faqs.question: What is dermatomyositis?
faqs.answer: Dermatomyositis is a rare autoimmune disease characterized by muscle inflammation and distinctive skin rashes. It primarily affects the muscles, causing weakness, and can lead to red or purple rashes, often on the face, eyelids, and joints.

faqs.question: Can dermatomyositis affect my daily life?
faqs.answer: Yes, dermatomyositis can impact daily activities due to muscle weakness and skin discomfort. With appropriate treatment, many people can manage their symptoms and lead active, fulfilling lives. Adjustments such as assistance with mobility or using UV protection for the skin may be necessary.

name: Psoriasis
introduction: Psoriasis is an autoimmune disorder- it occurs due to hyperactivity of your immune system. In it, your skin replicates much faster than that of usual speed, leading to scale formation over the skin and red patches. It can occur anywhere in the body, but most commonly, it attacks the scalp, elbows, lower back, and knees. However, it is not contagious. It does not spread through touch because it occurs due to an abnormal reaction of your immune system, rather than an attack of a parasite. Psoriasis starts to show its symptoms mostly in early adulthood. In some people, it may even cover large patches of the body. However, they may heal and get back to normal. It is a long term condition with no such cure. The attacks may flare up and settle over time. However, symptoms can be managed with supportive treatment. Also, some lifestyle habits can help in coping up with the disease.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of psoriasis vary from person to person. Generally, it shows the following signs and symptoms;
points: Dry flaky and cracked skin that may cause itching and eventually bleeding

risk_factors: Genetics - A family history of psoriasis is one of the most significant risk factors. Individuals with a parent or sibling who has psoriasis are more likely to develop the condition themselves. Certain genetic markers, such as the HLA-Cw6 gene, have been associated with an increased risk of psoriasis.

Immune System Dysfunction - Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease, which means that it occurs when the body's immune system mistakenly attacks healthy skin cells, causing them to reproduce too quickly. This dysfunction of the immune system is a key factor in the development of psoriasis.

Environmental Factors - Exposure to certain environmental factors, such as harsh chemicals, extreme weather conditions, and physical trauma to the skin (known as the Koebner phenomenon), can trigger psoriasis flare-ups. These factors can irritate the skin and lead to the development of new lesions.

worse_factors.description: Stress is one of the most common triggers for psoriasis flare-ups. Emotional stress can stimulate the immune system, causing an inflammatory response that leads to the development of psoriasis patches. Managing stress through techniques such as meditation, yoga, and relaxation exercises can help control flare-ups.

Heavy alcohol consumption can trigger psoriasis flare-ups or make existing symptoms worse. Alcohol can interfere with the effectiveness of psoriasis medications and increase the risk of flare-ups by promoting inflammation in the body. Limiting alcohol intake or avoiding it completely is recommended for people with psoriasis.

Certain foods may trigger or worsen psoriasis in some people. Common dietary triggers include gluten, processed foods, red meat, dairy, and spicy foods. A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, omega-3 fatty acids, and anti-inflammatory foods can help reduce inflammation and manage symptoms.

treatment: Oatmeal Baths - Oatmeal has natural soothing properties that help reduce itching and irritation associated with psoriasis. It can also help moisturize dry skin and calm inflammation. Add colloidal oatmeal to a lukewarm bath and soak for 15-20 minutes. Gently pat the skin dry after the bath and apply a moisturizer to lock in hydration.

Neem is a powerful herb with antibacterial, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory properties that help alleviate symptoms of psoriasis, including scaling, itching, and skin irritation. It can also help detoxify the skin and reduce flare-ups.Use neem oil on the affected areas or apply a neem leaf paste to the skin. Neem-infused soaps or creams may also be beneficial for daily use.

Tea tree oil has antifungal, antibacterial, and anti-inflammatory properties that help reduce scaliness, redness, and itchiness caused by psoriasis. It also has a soothing effect on the skin.Dilute tea tree oil with a carrier oil (like coconut oil or olive oil) and apply to the affected areas 2-3 times daily.

faqs.question: What is psoriasis meaning in urdu?
faqs.answer: Psoriasis meaning in urdu is Chumbalچنبل

faqs.question: What is psoriasis disease?
faqs.answer: Psoriasis is a chronic (long-lasting) disease in which the immune system becomes overactive, causing skin cells to multiply too quickly. Patches of thick, red, scaly skin appear on the body, and the condition can cause discomfort and itchiness. Psoriasis is not contagious, and the exact cause is unknown, though genetics and environmental triggers are believed to play a role.

faqs.question: What are 3 symptoms of psoriasis?
faqs.answer: The 3 main symptoms of psoriasis are a patchy rash that varies widely in how it looks from person to person, ranging from spots of dandruff-like scaling to major eruptions over much of the body; rashes that vary in color, tending to be shades of purple with gray scale on brown or Black skin and pink or red with silver scale on white skin; and small scaling spots (commonly seen in children).

faqs.question: What exactly causes psoriasis?
faqs.answer: The exact cause of psoriasis is unknown, though it is believed to be related to a problem with the immune system. Research suggests that it is caused by a combination of genetics, environmental triggers, and an overactive immune system.

name: Lupus
introduction: Lupus is an autoimmune disease- a condition in which your own body attacks healthy cells and damages them. During an autoimmune reaction, your body perceives its own part as a foreign particle and launches an immune response against it. It is a lifelong condition that needs to be managed properly. Until now, there is no cure for it.
subline: Lupus are inflammation, damage, and swelling of joints, kidneys, blood, heart, lungs, and skin. It is often difficult to diagnose lupus because its symptoms resemble other diseases. The characteristic symptom of it is a rash on both cheeks, having the shape of a butterfly. Due to its varied symptoms, experts call it a disease of 1000 faces.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of lupus vary a lot. The two patients having the same disease that is lupus may complain about different symptoms. Lupus may show its signs and symptoms gradually or suddenly. They may remain permanent or temporary, ranging from mild to severe in intensity. Mostly the symptoms are mild, but they may aggravate at times called a flare. After that, they may get better over time. The signs and symptoms of lupus vary, depending on the type of body system involved. It can involve;
points: rashes- a characteristic butterfly rash on the face
Sjogren’s syndrome- that is accompanied by chronic dry eyes and dry mouth
pericarditis and pleuritis (pleuritis), which both can cause chest pain

risk_factors: Female gender- women are at more risk of having lupus as compared to men.
Age- people between the age of 15 to 44 are more often diagnosed with lupus. However, it can occur at any age.
Family history- having a family history of lupus puts you at risk of developing it.

worse_factors.description: Stress is one of the most common triggers for psoriasis flare-ups. Emotional stress can stimulate the immune system, causing an inflammatory response that leads to the development of psoriasis patches. Managing stress through techniques such as meditation, yoga, and relaxation exercises can help control flare-ups.

Heavy alcohol consumption can trigger psoriasis flare-ups or make existing symptoms worse. Alcohol can interfere with the effectiveness of psoriasis medications and increase the risk of flare-ups by promoting inflammation in the body. Limiting alcohol intake or avoiding it completely is recommended for people with psoriasis.

Certain foods may trigger or worsen psoriasis in some people. Common dietary triggers include gluten, processed foods, red meat, dairy, and spicy foods. A balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, omega-3 fatty acids, and anti-inflammatory foods can help reduce inflammation and manage symptoms.

treatment: Echinacea is well-known for its immune-boosting abilities. It helps stimulate the immune system, which can be beneficial in controlling the symptoms of lupus. However, it should be used with care, as it may interact with immunosuppressive medications.Echinacea can be consumed as a tea, tincture, or capsule. It’s best to consult a healthcare provider before using it, particularly if you're on immunosuppressive drugs.

Omega-3 fatty acids, found in fish oil, have anti-inflammatory properties that help reduce joint inflammation and swelling, common symptoms in lupus. Omega-3s can also improve cardiovascular health, which is important since lupus can increase the risk of heart disease.You can take fish oil supplements or include fatty fish (like salmon or mackerel) in your diet to gain the benefits of omega-3s.

Alfalfa is often used in herbal medicine to help manage autoimmune disorders like lupus. It contains high levels of vitamin K, minerals, and antioxidants, which may help reduce inflammation and support overall health.Alfalfa can be consumed as sprouts, tea, or in capsule form. However, individuals on blood-thinning medications should avoid alfalfa.

faqs.question: What is lupus?
faqs.answer: Lupus is a chronic autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks its own healthy tissues and organs, causing inflammation and damage. It can affect various parts of the body, including the skin, joints, kidneys, heart, and lungs.

faqs.question: What causes lupus?
faqs.answer: The exact cause of lupus is not known, but it is believed to result from a combination of genetic, environmental, and hormonal factors. Certain infections, medications, and stress can trigger lupus flare-ups in people who are genetically predisposed to the disease.

name: Sunstroke
introduction: Sunstroke, also known as heatstroke, is a condition in which your body overheats due to prolonged exposure to heat. It is an emergency condition that needs prompt medical treatment. Most commonly, it affects people over the age of 50, but it can affect young athletes.
subline: Heatstroke, if left untreated, can damage your organs like the brain, kidneys, muscles, and heart due to excessive heat. It can start with muscle cramps, dizziness, and exhaustion. The later the patient gets treatment, the chances of organ damage increase.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of heatstroke are;
points: Raised body temperature- prolonged exposure to heat raises your body temperature to 104 degrees Fahrenheit. If it rises more, it can cause organ damage.
Changes in sweating- through sweating, your body cools down itself. But during heat stroke, it stops doing that, leaving your skin hot and dry upon touch.
Flushing- due to excessive heat, your skin can become red.
Rapid breathing- raised body temperature can make it difficult for you to breathe properly.
Increased heart rate- excessive heat can stress your heart to work more and more, resulting in increased heart rate.
Headache- heatstroke can cause a throbbing headache.

risk_factors: Old age
Physical activity in hot and humid weather
Getting exposed to hot weather suddenly, when you travel different places
Having a lack of air conditioning can turn the temperature cold and less humid.
Taking drugs like beta-blockers, diuretic, antipsychotic, and antidepressant
Being obese
Having lung and heart diseases

worse_factors.description: Not seeking medical help immediately can lead to organ damage or even be fatal.
Staying under direct sunlight worsens dehydration and overheating.
Not drinking enough water can lead to severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance.
Wearing non-breathable fabrics traps heat and prevents the body from cooling down.
Exercise or physical labor in high temperatures can worsen symptoms by increasing body heat.
These substances contribute to dehydration and can interfere with the body's ability to regulate temperature.

treatment: Wear clothes that are light and comfortable.
Wear sunscreen while going out on a sunny day
Drink plenty of fluids, especially if you take diuretics
Do not sit in a parked car or let your child sit as it causes a rise of 20 degrees Fahrenheit even in 10 minutes.
Do not exercise on a hot sunny day, instead wait for the nighttime when the air becomes a bit cool. Also, drink plenty of water and replenish lost electrolytes.

faqs.question: What is sunstroke?
faqs.answer: Sunstroke, or heatstroke, is a serious heat-related illness that occurs when the body overheats and can no longer regulate its temperature. It can lead to organ damage or even be fatal if not treated quickly.

faqs.question: What causes sunstroke?
faqs.answer: Sunstroke is caused by prolonged exposure to high temperatures, especially in direct sunlight, combined with dehydration and poor heat dissipation.

faqs.question: How long does it take to recover from sunstroke?
faqs.answer: Recovery depends on the severity. Mild cases may resolve in a few days with rest and hydration, while severe cases may require hospitalization and take weeks to fully recover.

name: Rosacea
introduction: Rosacea is a long-term skin condition that primarily affects the face. The nose, cheeks, and forehead are mostly involved. It may represent bumps and redness on the affected areas.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Rosacea are;
points: Redness and flushing of the face
Change in nose shape or thick nose

risk_factors: Rosacea can affect anyone, but middle-aged females are at risk. Moreover, fair-skinned people are at risk. Family history may play a role in getting rosacea too.

Rosacea does not spread from one person to another, which means it is not contagious. So neither you can catch it from someone by close contact, nor can transmit it to anyone. Also, it is not caused due to poor hygiene.

worse_factors.description: Extreme temperatures, strong winds, and humidity can worsen symptoms.Protect your skin with scarves in winter and use cooling measures in summer.
Spices like chili, hot peppers, and even certain condiments can trigger redness.Consider milder food options if you notice flare-ups after spicy meals.
Harsh soaps, exfoliants, and alcohol-based products can irritate the skin.Opt for gentle, fragrance-free skincare products labeled for sensitive skin.

treatment: Your dermatologist might prescribe you topical ointments to help reduce redness and inflammation or oral medications. Both may be used at the same time too.
For topical application, your dermatologist might suggest metronidazole, azelaic acid, or brimonidine.

For oral medications, antibiotics like metronidazole, doxycycline, minocycline, or ivermectin may be given. Moreover, your dermatologist may give isotretinoin which is similar to vitamin A, which is also used for treating stubborn acne.
Your dermatologist may also suggest laser therapy if your rosacea is severe.

faqs.question: What is rosacea?
faqs.answer: Rosacea is a chronic skin condition that causes redness, visible blood vessels, and sometimes acne-like bumps on the face. It can also cause eye irritation (ocular rosacea) in some cases.

faqs.question: What causes rosacea?
faqs.answer: The exact cause is unknown, but factors like genetics, an overactive immune system, and environmental triggers play a role. Some researchers also link rosacea to the Demodex mite, a microscopic organism that lives on the skin.

name: Shingles
introduction: Shingle is a viral infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus- the same virus that causes chickenpox. After decades of having chickenpox, the virus may remain in your nervous system and it may activate anytime causing shingles. It presents as a painful rash. Chickenpox appears all over the body, including the back, chest, and body. But shingles mostly cause rashes on one side of the body as a stripe, mostly on the torso, neck, and face. It is not a life-threatening condition, but it is highly painful as the blisters cause a burning sensation along with pain. Vaccines can help in reducing its risk. Early treatment can help prevent its complications. The most common complication of shingles is postherpetic neuralgia which causes shingle pain long after it has cleared out.

symptoms.des: Chickenpox appears all over the body, including the back, chest, and body. But shingles mostly cause painful, burning rashes on one side of the body as a stripe, mostly on the torso, neck, and face. They appear on a small part of the body. The characteristics of those rashes are;
points: wraps around from the spine to the torso on the face and ears.

risk_factors: Being older than 50
Having a disease that weakens your immune system like AIDS, malignancies, and repeated infections
Taking medications that suppresses the immune system like corticosteroids
Undergoing therapies that suppress the immune system like radiotherapy or chemotherapy for cancer

worse_factors.description: Conditions like HIV/AIDS, cancer, diabetes, and autoimmune diseases can make shingles worse.Immunosuppressive medications (e.g., chemotherapy, steroids) may also increase the severity of symptoms
Scratching can lead to infection, scarring, and worsening pain.Keep the rash clean and covered to avoid bacterial infections.
A nutrient-rich diet (vitamins B12, C, and zinc) helps the body fight the virus.Processed foods, sugar, and dehydration can slow recovery.

treatment: Aloe Vera 🌱 - Soothes itching, reduces inflammation, and speeds up healing.Apply fresh aloe vera gel directly to the rash 2-3 times a day.
Apple Cider Vinegar 🍏 - Has antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties that help dry out blisters.Dilute with equal parts water, dab on affected areas with a cotton ball, and rinse after 10 minutes.
Echinacea 🌼 - Boosts the immune system and fights viral infections.Take echinacea tea or supplements to strengthen immunity.
Chamomile Tea ☕ - Anti-inflammatory, calming, and aids skin healing.Apply chilled chamomile tea bags to the rash or drink chamomile tea for relaxation.
Peppermint Oil (Cooling & numbing effect) - Dilute a few drops in coconut or olive oil and apply gently to the rash.

faqs.question: What is shingles disease meaning in urdu?
faqs.answer: Shingles Meaning in Urdu is Roray روڑے.

faqs.question: What is the main cause of shingles?
faqs.answer: The main cause of shingles is the varicella-zoster virus, a member of the herpes family of viruses. This virus is the same virus that causes chickenpox. After a person has chickenpox, the virus remains in the body in a dormant state. In some cases, the virus can become reactivated and cause shingles. However, the exact cause of virus reactivation is not known.

faqs.question: What are the first signs of having shingles?
faqs.answer: The first signs of having shingles can include pain, tingling, or burning in the area where the rash will eventually appear, as well as headache, fever, and chills. These symptoms may start a few days before the rash appears. The rash usually appears as a stripe of blisters that wraps around either the left or right side of the torso.

name: Alopecia
introduction: Alopecia refers to hair loss that can occur on the scalp or other parts of the body. It can be temporary or permanent, and it affects people of all ages and genders. Hair loss can result from various factors, including genetics, autoimmune disorders, hormonal changes, stress, and nutritional deficiencies. The severity of alopecia ranges from mild thinning to complete baldness.

points: Gradual thinning of hair (especially on the scalp)
Sudden patchy hair loss (common in alopecia areata)
Receding hairline or widening part (in androgenetic alopecia)
Excessive shedding of hair after brushing or washing
Complete loss of hair on the scalp or body (in severe cases)
Redness, itching, or inflammation (in scarring alopecia)

risk_factors: Genetics - A family history of baldness increases the likelihood of hair loss.
Autoimmune Diseases - Conditions like lupus and alopecia areata can trigger hair loss.
Hormonal Imbalances  Pregnancy, menopause, thyroid disorders, and PCOS can cause hair thinning.
Nutritional Deficiencies - Lack of iron, zinc, vitamin D, and protein can weaken hair
Chronic Stress - Emotional or physical stress can push hair follicles into the resting phase, leading to shedding.
Harsh Hair Treatments - Frequent dyeing, heat styling, and chemical treatments can damage hair.
Certain Medications - Chemotherapy, blood pressure drugs, and antidepressants can cause hair loss.

worse_factors.description: Tight Hairstyles (e.g., braids, ponytails) that cause traction alopecia.
Harsh Chemical Treatments (bleaching, perming, excessive hair dyeing)
Unhealthy Diet lacking essential vitamins and minerals

treatment: Onion Juice - Onion juice is rich in sulfur, which stimulates hair follicles and improves blood circulation to the scalp. It has been found effective in treating alopecia areata.Extract onion juice, apply it to the scalp for 15-20 minutes, then wash with mild shampoo.
Rosemary Oil - Has antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties that help dry out blisters.Dilute with equal parts water, dab on affected areas with a cotton ball, and rinse after 10 minutes.

Echinacea 🌼 - Rosemary oil is known for its ability to improve circulation and stimulate hair growth. Studies suggest it may be as effective as minoxidil for androgenetic alopecia.Mix a few drops of rosemary oil with coconut or olive oil, massage into the scalp, and leave for a few hours before washing.

Fenugreek Seeds - Fenugreek contains proteins and nicotinic acid, which help stimulate hair growth and strengthen follicles.Soak fenugreek seeds overnight, grind them into a paste, apply to the scalp for 30 minutes, and wash off.

faqs.question: Alopecia can be reversed?
faqs.answer: It depends on the type of alopecia. Some cases, like telogen effluvium, are temporary and hair regrows with proper care. Other types, like scarring alopecia, may be permanent if hair follicles are destroyed.

faqs.question: Alopecia is hereditary?
faqs.answer: Yes, androgenetic alopecia (pattern baldness) is largely genetic. If your parents have hair loss, you may have a higher risk.

faqs.question: Are there medical treatments for alopecia?
faqs.answer: Yes, conventional treatments include minoxidil (Rogaine), finasteride, corticosteroids, and hair transplants for severe cases.

name: Dandruff
introduction: Dandruff causes flaking of the skin that mostly appears on the scalp causing low self-esteem. It does not occur due to poor hygiene. But it may become prominent if you do not wash your hair. Dandruff is more common in people who have dry skin. It is a mild form of a condition called seborrheic dermatitis, also known as seborrheic eczema, or crib cab when it occurs in infants. It does not cause bothersome symptoms. But itching and low self-esteem because of it can hinder your life. Oiling your hair can help in getting rid of it. The various reasons for it include seborrheic dermatitis and other conditions too like eczema, psoriasis, and allergy.  According to experts, the exact cause of seborrheic dermatitis is unknown. But they believe the two main causative agents are oil and fungus. Therefore reduction of oil on the skin can help get rid of it. If you have this condition cleanse with gentle soap and anti dandruff shampoo.
subline: It is not contagious, which means it does not spread through touch. Using medicated shampoos, especially one that has selenium sulfide in it can help get rid of it. However, symptoms may appear back.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of dandruff are;
points: Skin flakes on beard or mustache
Scaly, crusty scalp in infants with cradle cap

risk_factors: Obesity
Fatigue
Cold and dry weather
Poor skincare
Stress
Exposure to environmental pollution like dust, smoke, and dirt
Coexistence of other skin condition like acne, psoriasis, and rosacea

worse_factors.description: Infrequent hair washing can lead to buildup of oil, dirt, and dead skin cells, creating an ideal environment for dandruff-causing fungi.Overwashing, on the other hand, can strip natural oils, making the scalp dry and flaky.

Hair sprays, gels, and styling creams can cause product buildup, irritating the scalp and worsening dandruff.Certain hair dyes and chemical treatments may trigger contact dermatitis, increasing flaking and itching.
Dust, dirt, and environmental pollutants clog hair follicles, leading to scalp irritation and increased flaking.

treatment: Fenugreek Seeds - Fenugreek contains proteins and nicotinic acid, which help stimulate hair growth and strengthen follicles.Soak fenugreek seeds overnight, grind them into a paste, apply to the scalp for 30 minutes, and wash off.

Hibiscus Flower - Hibiscus contains amino acids and vitamin C, which nourish the scalp and boost hair growth.Blend hibiscus flowers into a paste and mix with coconut oil. Apply to the scalp and wash after an hour.
Ginseng - Ginseng helps stimulate hair follicles and reduce hair thinning.Take ginseng supplements or apply ginseng-infused oil to the scalp.

Basil (Tulsi) Leaves - Basil has antibacterial and antifungal properties that help reduce dandruff and soothe the scalp.Make a paste of basil leaves and water, apply to the scalp, and rinse after 30 minutes.

faqs.question: What is dandruff?
faqs.answer: Dandruff is a common scalp condition that causes flaking of the skin. It is often accompanied by itching, dryness, or irritation but is not contagious or serious.

faqs.question: Can dandruff be cured?
faqs.answer: Dandruff can often be managed and controlled but may not have a permanent cure. Using anti-dandruff shampoos, herbal treatments, and maintaining good scalp hygiene can help reduce symptoms.

faqs.question: Can dandruff cause hair loss?
faqs.answer: Dandruff itself does not cause hair loss, but excessive scratching and scalp inflammation can weaken hair follicles, leading to temporary hair thinning or shedding

name: Premature-Graying
introduction: Premature graying of hair (also called canities) refers to the early loss of hair pigment, leading to white or gray hair before the age of 25 in Asians, 20 in Caucasians, and 30 in Africans. Hair gets its color from melanin, produced by melanocytes in hair follicles. When melanin production decreases or stops, hair turns gray or white.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Premature-Graying are;
points: Loss of natural hair color (gray, silver, or white strands)
Gradual increase in the number of gray hairs over time
Dryness and texture changes (gray hair may feel coarser or frizzier)
Increased hair fall in some cases
Lack of shine and dull appearance

risk_factors: Genetic Factors - If your parents or grandparents had early gray hair, you are more likely to experience the same.Genes determine the rate of melanin depletion in hair follicles.
Nutritional Deficiencies - Vitamin B12 Deficiency, Iron Deficiency, Copper Deficiency, Lack of Protein and Antioxidants
Stress and Anxiety - Chronic stress produces oxidative stress that damages hair follicles.Psychological stress can reduce melanocyte activity, leading to premature graying.

worse_factors.description: Lack of vitamins (B12, D, copper, zinc) worsens graying.
Leads to oxidative stress and damages hair pigment.
Sulfates, ammonia-based dyes, and heat styling weaken hair.

treatment: Amla (Indian Gooseberry) - Amla is rich in vitamin C and antioxidants, which nourish hair follicles and prevent premature graying.Mix amla powder with coconut oil and massage into the scalp.Drink fresh amla juice daily for better results.

Curry Leaves - Curry leaves are packed with B vitamins and beta-carotene, which help maintain hair pigment.Boil curry leaves in coconut oil and apply the oil to the scalp 2-3 times a week.Consume fresh curry leaves in your diet.

Bhringraj (False Daisy) - Bhringraj is known as the King of Hair Herbs, helping to darken hair naturally.Apply Bhringraj oil to the scalp and leave it overnight.Drink Bhringraj tea for internal nourishment.

Henna and Indigo Powder - Henna is a natural hair dye that conditions and strengthens hair, while indigo restores darker tones.Make a paste of henna and indigo powder, apply to hair, and rinse after 2-3 hours.

faqs.question: Can premature graying be reversed?
faqs.answer: If caused by nutritional deficiencies or stress, it can be slowed or slightly reversed. If genetic, reversal is unlikely, but herbal treatments can delay further graying.

faqs.question: Can pollution cause premature graying?
faqs.answer: Yes, exposure to toxins and UV rays causes oxidative damage, leading to early graying.

name: Scalp Infection
introduction: A scalp infection occurs when bacteria, fungi, or viruses affect the skin and hair follicles on the scalp, leading to itching, redness, flakes, sores, and hair loss. It can result from poor hygiene, excessive oil buildup, weakened immunity, or infections like ringworm, folliculitis, or seborrheic dermatitis. If left untreated, scalp infections can cause severe irritation, hair thinning, and even permanent hair loss.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Scalp Infection are;
points: Redness, swelling, and inflammation on the scalp
Hair loss in patches or thinning hair
Crusty, yellow, or white scales on the scalp

risk_factors: Poor Hygiene - Infrequent hair washing can lead to oil and dirt buildup, allowing bacteria or fungi to grow.
Excessive Oil Production - Sebum buildup creates a perfect environment for yeast and bacteria to thrive.
Weak Immune System - People with diabetes, autoimmune diseases, or nutritional deficiencies are more prone to infections.
Sharing Personal Items - Sharing combs, towels, hats, or hair accessories can spread fungal or bacterial infections.
Hot and Humid Weather - High humidity causes excess sweat and moisture, leading to fungal overgrowth.

worse_factors.description: Can worsen inflammation and spread infection.

worse_factors.point: Using Dirty Hair Brushes or Towels
worse_factors.description: Can reintroduce bacteria or fungi.
Eczema, psoriasis, and severe dandruff can worsen infections.

treatment: Neem (Azadirachta indica) - Neem has antibacterial, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory properties, making it one of the best remedies for scalp infections.Boil neem leaves in water, let it cool, and use it as a final hair rinse.Apply neem oil to the scalp and leave it overnight before washing.
Hibiscus Leaves - Hibiscus has antifungal properties and strengthens hair follicles.Grind fresh hibiscus leaves into a paste and apply it to the scalp.
Fenugreek Seeds (Methi) - Fenugreek seeds have antibacterial and anti-inflammatory benefits.Soak fenugreek seeds overnight, grind into a paste, and apply to the scalp.

faqs.question: How long does it take for a scalp infection to heal?
faqs.answer: Mild infections heal within 1-2 weeks with proper treatment, while severe cases may take 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Can diet affect scalp infections?
faqs.answer: Yes, eating a healthy diet rich in vitamins, zinc, and antioxidants helps maintain a healthy scalp.

name: Hair Thining
introduction: Hair thinning is a gradual reduction in hair density, leading to weaker, finer, and less voluminous hair. It is different from baldness, as it does not cause complete hair loss but makes the scalp more visible over time. Hair thinning can result from aging, genetics, poor nutrition, stress, hormonal imbalances, or medical conditions. If left untreated, it may progress to significant hair loss.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Hair thinning are;
points: Gradual hair thinning on the scalp, especially around the parting and crown
Increased hair shedding while combing or washing
Slow hair growth or stunted regrowth
Loss of hair volume and density

risk_factors: Aging - As people age, hair follicles shrink, leading to thinner and weaker hair strands.
Chronic Stress - Stress increases cortisol levels, which can push hair into the shedding phase (telogen effluvium).
Excessive Hair Washing or Tight Hairstyles - Frequent shampooing with harsh sulfates and tight hairstyles like ponytails or braids can weaken hair.

worse_factors.description: Sulfates, parabens, and alcohol-based products strip hair of natural oils.

worse_factors.point: Frequent Use of Heat Styling Tools
worse_factors.description: Straighteners, curling irons, and blow dryers damage hair cuticles.
Chemicals weaken hair structure.

treatment: Fenugreek Seeds (Methi) - Fenugreek is rich in proteins and nicotinic acid, which boost hair growth.Soak fenugreek seeds overnight, grind into a paste, and apply to the scalp.
Rosemary Oil - Rosemary oil is known to stimulate hair follicles and improve scalp circulation.Mix a few drops of rosemary oil with carrier oil and massage into the scalp.
Hibiscus Flower - Hibiscus strengthens roots, prevents breakage, and promotes new hair growth.Make a paste of hibiscus petals and leaves, apply it to the scalp for 30 minutes, then rinse
Flaxseeds - Flaxseeds are rich in omega-3 fatty acids, which nourish hair and prevent dryness.Consume flaxseeds daily or apply flaxseed gel to the scalp.

faqs.question: Can hair thinning be reversed?
faqs.answer: Yes, early intervention with herbal remedies, a healthy diet, and proper scalp care can reverse hair thinning.

faqs.question: Can natural oils regrow hair?
faqs.answer: Yes, coconut oil, rosemary oil, and castor oil nourish hair follicles and promote regrowth.

name: Indigestion
introduction: Indigestion, also known as dyspepsia, is a common digestive issue that causes discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen. It occurs due to poor digestion, overeating, acid reflux, or underlying gastrointestinal conditions. Indigestion is not a disease but rather a symptom of digestive distress, which may be triggered by lifestyle habits or food choices.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Indigestion are;
points: Burning sensation or pain in the upper abdomen
Feeling of fullness or bloating after eating
Loss of appetite due to discomfort

risk_factors: Eating Habits - Overeating or eating too fast,Consuming too much greasy, fatty, or spicy foods,Drinking carbonated beverages and excessive caffeine, Eating late at night before sleeping
Lifestyle Choices - High stress and anxiety levels,Excessive alcohol consumption,Smoking and tobacco use, Lack of physical activity

worse_factors.description: Overloading the stomach slows digestion.
Increases acid reflux risk.

worse_factors.point: Skipping Meals or Eating at Irregular Times
worse_factors.description: Disrupts digestion.
Weakens the lower esophageal sphincter, allowing acid reflux.

treatment: Peppermint - Peppermint relaxes the digestive tract muscles and reduces bloating.Drink peppermint tea for quick relief.Use peppermint oil capsules for acid reflux-related indigestion.
Fennel Seeds (Saunf) - Fennel seeds reduce gas, bloating, and stomach cramps.Chew a teaspoon of fennel seeds after meals.Boil fennel seeds in water and drink it as tea.
Cumin Seeds - Cumin helps reduce gas, bloating, and stomach pain.Boil cumin seeds in water and drink as tea.Add cumin powder to meals for better digestion.
Carom Seeds (Ajwain) - Carom seeds help relieve acidity and gas.Chew a teaspoon of carom seeds with warm water after meals.

faqs.question: What are the common causes of indigestion?
faqs.answer: Indigestion is caused by overeating, stress, poor diet, acid reflux, food intolerances, and underlying digestive conditions.

faqs.question: How can I prevent indigestion naturally?
faqs.answer: Eat smaller meals, chew food properly, drink plenty of water, avoid spicy and fatty foods, and manage stress.

faqs.question: What foods should I avoid if I have indigestion?
faqs.answer: Avoid fried foods, carbonated drinks, caffeine, alcohol, spicy foods, and processed foods.

faqs.question: Can drinking water help with indigestion?
faqs.answer: Yes, drinking warm water can improve digestion, but avoid drinking large amounts with meals as it dilutes stomach acid.

name: Constipation
introduction: Constipation is a common digestive issue characterized by infrequent, difficult, or painful bowel movements. It occurs when stool moves too slowly through the digestive tract, leading to hard and dry stools. While occasional constipation is normal, chronic constipation can indicate an underlying health condition and may require medical attention.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Constipation are;
points: Less than three bowel movements per week
Straining or pain during bowel movements
Loss of appetite due to digestive discomfort

risk_factors: Dietary Factors - Low fiber intake, Inadequate water consumption, Excessive consumption of processed foods

Medical Conditions - Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Diabetes and thyroid disorders, Neurological disorders (Parkinson’s, Multiple Sclerosis), Hemorrhoids or anal fissures - Pain discourages bowel movements.

worse_factors.description: Lacking whole grains, fruits, and vegetables.
Not drinking enough water.
Weakens natural bowel movement ability.
Affects gut health and slows bowel function.

treatment: Psyllium Husk (Isabgol) - Psyllium is a natural fiber supplement that adds bulk to stools and promotes bowel movements.Mix one teaspoon of psyllium husk with warm water before bed.
Triphala - Triphala is an Ayurvedic herbal blend of amla, haritaki, and bibhitaki, known for its mild laxative effects.Drink Triphala tea or take Triphala powder before bedtime.
Senna Leaves - Senna is a natural stimulant laxative that encourages bowel movement.Drink Senna tea before bedtime for relief.

faqs.question: How does exercise help with constipation?
faqs.answer: Physical activity stimulates the intestinal muscles and improves bowel movement.

faqs.question: What drinks help with constipation?
faqs.answer: Warm lemon water, Aloe vera juice, Prune juice, Ginger tea, Chamomile tea

name: Diarrhea
introduction: Diarrhea is a common health problem in which you need to have more frequent bowel movements. It is characterized by loose, watery stools. Often diarrhea lasts for one to two days. However, it can be acute or chronic- that lasts for at least four weeks. Generally, it goes away on its own. But sometimes, you need to take an antibiotic or an antiprotozoal drug if it turns infectious. Diarrhea that remains for a long time indicates some other underlying health condition like irritable bowel syndrome or persistent infection.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of diarrhea are;
points: Urgent need to have a bowel movement

risk_factors: Viruses - Norwalk virus,Cytomegalovirus, Viral hepatitis, Rotavirus in children

Bacteria - Drinking water or eating food that is contaminated can transmit bacteria to your body, eventually causing diarrhea. If you travel to developing countries and get diarrhea, it is called travelers diarrhea.

Lactose intolerance - Lactose intolerance is a condition in which your body can not digest lactose- a sugar found in milk, due to which diarrhea occurs. People having lactose intolerance find it difficult to digest dairy products. The problem can increase as you age because the enzymes that help digest milk decline over time. Those with lactose intolerance should drink lactose-free milk to prevent diarrhea.
Fructose - Fructose- a sugar found in fruits can also cause diarrhea. Sometimes it is also used as a sweetener in different beverages and desserts, eventually causing loose and watery stools.
Artificial sweeteners - Sorbitol and mannitol are the artificial sweeteners used in chewing gums, candies, and other sugar-free products. They can also cause diarrhea in some healthy people.

worse_factors.description: Losing too much fluid through diarrhea without replenishing it can lead to severe dehydration, making symptoms worse.
Fried and greasy foods are difficult to digest and can stimulate more bowel movements.
Milk, cheese, and ice cream contain lactose, which many people struggle to digest, especially during diarrhea.
Soda and sparkling water increase gas formation, leading to more bloating and discomfort.

treatment: To treat diarrhea, the healthcare providers may prescribe antibiotics or antiprotozoal drugs, depending upon the causative agent. Along with it, most importantly, they will ask you to rehydrate yourself. You can drink an oral rehydration solution to replenish lost electrolytes. Make sure you keep rehydrating yourself, otherwise, it can result in a life-threatening condition.

faqs.question: What is the meaning of diarrhea in urdu?
faqs.answer: Diarrhea meaning in Urdu is 'dast / ashaal'. It is the frequent passage of loose or watery stools. It is usually the result of an infection, but can also be caused by a more serious underlying condition such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis.

faqs.question: Whats diarrhea means?
faqs.answer: Diarrhea is the frequent passage of loose or watery stools. It is usually the result of an infection but can also be caused by a more serious underlying condition such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis. Diarrhea can be acute, lasting only a few days, or chronic, lasting for weeks or even months. Symptoms can include abdominal pain, cramping, bloating, nausea, and fever. Treatment depends on the cause and can include antibiotics, probiotics, or dietary changes.

faqs.question: What are 3 symptoms of diarrhea?
faqs.answer: The three main symptoms of diarrhea are loose or watery stools, abdominal pain or cramping, and bloating. Other symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, fever, and dehydration.

faqs.question: Whats causes diarrhea?
faqs.answer: The most common causes of diarrhea are viral infections, bacterial infections, food poisoning, food allergies, stress, certain medications, and digestive problems. Other possible causes include excessive alcohol consumption, morning sickness, vertigo, chemotherapy, and other medical conditions.

name: AnxietyDisorder
introduction: Anxiety is a natural feeling of anxiousness and fear in response to stress. We all feel it in different stages of our life, but it is temporary. Sometimes it can become worse that it hastily affects your life.
subline: In anxiety disorder, fear and restlessness are not temporary. It gets worse by the time and affects the person’s health so much that they become home-bound, or even they do not come out from their rooms. Those who suffer from anxiety attacks find it so difficult to deal with them. But along with supportive and symptomatic treatment, one can control the symptoms of anxiety.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Anxiety Disorder are;
points: Not being able to calm down
Can not stop thinking and worrying about the same thing
Avoiding things extremely which causes you to fear.

risk_factors: Generalized Anxiety Disorder- a disorder in which you feel worried and tense for no reason.
Panic attack- a feeling of intense fear that brings anxiety. It is often accompanied by palpitations, sweating, chest pain and you may feel like choking.
Social anxiety disorder- when you constantly or overly worry about what others think of you. You feel excessive about others judging or ridiculing you
Agoraphobia- a feeling of fear to escape from a place if any emergency occurs. It can be a shopping mall, a crowded bus or train or standing in a queue.

worse_factors.description: Coffee, energy drinks, and tea contain caffeine, which stimulates the nervous system, increasing heart rate and triggering anxiety symptoms.
Alcohol and drugs can initially provide temporary relief but later lead to withdrawal symptoms, worsening anxiety.

worse_factors.point: Poor Sleep (Insomnia or Irregular Sleep Schedule)
worse_factors.description: Lack of sleep affects brain function and increases stress hormones, leading to heightened anxiety.
Long-term stress exhausts the nervous system, making it harder to cope with anxiety.

treatment: Your healthcare provider will prescribe the treatment depending upon the severity of the anxiety. They may prescribe antidepressants, anxiolytics, and psychotherapy to cope with anxiety disorders.

faqs.question: what is anxiety meaning in urdu?
faqs.answer: Anxiety meaning in Urdu is “بے چینی, پریشانی”. It can be define as a feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. Other meanings of anxiety in Urdu are “Preshani” and “Uljhan.” Anxiety means feeling tense, worried, or nervous, and it is the body's natural response to stressful or dangerous situations.

faqs.question: What is the symptoms of anxiety?
faqs.answer: Symptoms of anxiety can include feeling restless or tense, having a sense of impending danger or panic, having an increased heart rate, breathing rapidly (hyperventilation), sweating, trembling, feeling weak or tired, trouble concentrating or thinking about anything other than the present worry, having trouble sleeping, experiencing gastrointestinal (GI) problems, having difficulty controlling worry, and having the urge to avoid things that trigger anxiety.

faqs.question: Is anxiety a form of mental illness?
faqs.answer: Yes, anxiety is a form of mental illness. Anxiety disorders are the most common of all mental health conditions. They can cause intense fear and worry and can interfere with your daily life. Anxiety can range from mild to severe and can be a short-term or chronic condition. Treatment options include therapy, medication, lifestyle changes, or a combination of these.

faqs.question: What causes it anxiety?
faqs.answer: Anxiety can be caused by a variety of factors, including genetics, brain chemistry, traumatic events, or environmental stress. It can also be caused by a combination of these factors.

herbalists_recommended.name: Assist. Prof. Dr. Muhammad Shoaib Zafar

name: StressDisorder
introduction: Acute stress disorder is often a temporary condition that occurs after any traumatic event that causes psychological distress. The symptoms of acute stress disorder may remain from 3 to 30 days. However, if they last longer than that, you must visit a healthcare provider.

symptoms.des: The symptoms of acute stress disorder resemble that of post-traumatic stress disorder. The signs and symptoms may include
points: Intrusion symptoms- A condition when a person is unable to forget the traumatic event. They can not stop the flashbacks of that event from their mind.
Mood- The person may have a low mood, sadness and may experience negative thoughts.
Dissociative symptoms- The person is unaware of their surroundings. They have an altered sense of reality. Moreover, they are also unable to remember parts of the traumatic event that happened.

risk_factors: Losing a loved one
Receiving threats of death
Getting any serious injury
natural calamities like earthquake or thunderstorms
Motor vehicle accidents
Getting raped or sexually assaulted
Undergoing domestic abuse
Receiving a diagnosis of terminal illness
Surviving a traumatic brain injury

worse_factors.description: Lack of sleep increases cortisol (stress hormone) levels, making it harder to cope with daily stress.
Coffee, energy drinks, and some medications stimulate the nervous system, increasing heart rate and triggering stress responses.
Exercise helps reduce stress hormones (cortisol) and boost mood. A sedentary lifestyle leads to pent-up tension and low energy.
Certain triggers (e.g., loud noises, locations, or reminders of trauma) can bring back painful memories.

treatment: Your healthcare provider will prescribe the treatment depending upon the severity of the anxiety. They may prescribe antidepressants, anxiolytics, and psychotherapy to cope with anxiety disorders.

faqs.question: what is anxiety meaning in urdu?
faqs.answer: Anxiety meaning in Urdu is “بے چینی, پریشانی”. It can be define as a feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. Other meanings of anxiety in Urdu are “Preshani” and “Uljhan.” Anxiety means feeling tense, worried, or nervous, and it is the body's natural response to stressful or dangerous situations.

faqs.question: What is the symptoms of anxiety?
faqs.answer: Symptoms of anxiety can include feeling restless or tense, having a sense of impending danger or panic, having an increased heart rate, breathing rapidly (hyperventilation), sweating, trembling, feeling weak or tired, trouble concentrating or thinking about anything other than the present worry, having trouble sleeping, experiencing gastrointestinal (GI) problems, having difficulty controlling worry, and having the urge to avoid things that trigger anxiety.

faqs.question: Is anxiety a form of mental illness?
faqs.answer: Yes, anxiety is a form of mental illness. Anxiety disorders are the most common of all mental health conditions. They can cause intense fear and worry and can interfere with your daily life. Anxiety can range from mild to severe and can be a short-term or chronic condition. Treatment options include therapy, medication, lifestyle changes, or a combination of these.

faqs.question: What causes it anxiety?
faqs.answer: Anxiety can be caused by a variety of factors, including genetics, brain chemistry, traumatic events, or environmental stress. It can also be caused by a combination of these factors.

herbalists_recommended.name: Assist. Prof. Dr. Muhammad Shoaib Zafar

name: Insomnia
introduction: Insomnia is a common sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall asleep, stay asleep, or get restful sleep. It can be acute (short-term) or chronic (long-term), affecting overall health, mood, and daily activities. Sleep deprivation can lead to serious health issues, including stress, weakened immunity, and cognitive impairment.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Insomnia may include
points: Difficulty falling asleep despite feeling tired
Waking up frequently during the night
Waking up too early and not being able to fall back asleep
Irritability, mood swings, and difficulty concentrating

risk_factors: Stress and Anxiety - Work, relationships, or financial worries can make it hard to relax
Poor Sleep Habits - Irregular sleep schedules, late-night screen time, and uncomfortable sleep environments.
Medical Conditions - Chronic pain, respiratory problems, heart disease, and digestive issues can disrupt sleep.
Mental Health Disorders - Anxiety, depression, and PTSD can contribute to chronic insomnia.
Caffeine and Alcohol Consumption - Stimulants and alcohol interfere with natural sleep patterns.
Shift Work and Jet Lag - Irregular working hours and travel across time zones can disrupt circadian rhythms.
Aging - Sleep patterns change with age, leading to increased sleep disturbances.

worse_factors.description: Blue light from phones, tablets, and computers suppresses melatonin production.
Both are stimulants that keep the brain alert and disrupt sleep.
Going to bed and waking up at different times can confuse the body’s internal clock.
Overthinking and worrying at night increase cortisol levels, making it harder to relax.

treatment: Valerian Root - Valerian root is a natural sedative that has been used for centuries to promote deep sleep. It helps increase GABA (gamma-aminobutyric acid) levels in the brain, reducing anxiety and promoting relaxation.
Ashwagandha - This adaptogenic herb helps regulate cortisol levels, reducing stress and promoting relaxation. It is beneficial for people suffering from stress-induced insomnia.
Passionflower - Passionflower is known to increase GABA levels, helping the brain relax and inducing sleep. It is especially useful for those with anxiety-related insomnia.

faqs.question: What are the main causes of insomnia?
faqs.answer: Insomnia can be caused by stress, anxiety, poor sleep habits, excessive caffeine intake, medical conditions, and irregular sleep schedules.

faqs.question: How does stress contribute to insomnia?
faqs.answer: Stress increases cortisol levels, making it difficult for the brain to relax and transition into sleep.

herbalists_recommended.name: Assist. Prof. Dr. Muhammad Shoaib Zafar

name: Obesity
introduction: Obesity is a complex medical condition characterized by excessive body fat accumulation that may negatively impact health. It is a global health concern associated with various chronic diseases, including heart disease, diabetes, and hypertension. Obesity is primarily caused by an imbalance between calorie intake and energy expenditure, but genetic, hormonal, and environmental factors also play significant roles.

symptoms.des: The signs and symptoms of Obesity may include
points: Excessive body fat, particularly around the abdomen
Shortness of breath, even with mild exertion
Joint pain, particularly in the knees and lower back
Low self-esteem and depression due to body image concerns
Increased risk of chronic diseases, including high blood pressure and diabetes

risk_factors: Poor Diet and Unhealthy Eating Habits - High intake of processed foods, sugary beverages, and fast food,Overeating high-calorie and low-nutrient foods
Sedentary Lifestyle - Minimal physical activity and long hours of sitting,Excessive screen time (TV, computers, smartphones)
Emotional and Psychological Factors - Stress eating or using food as a coping mechanism,Depression and anxiety leading to overeating

worse_factors.description: Sugary drinks and snacks contribute to rapid weight gain, High sugar levels lead to insulin resistance and fat storage
Reduces calorie burning and muscle strength,Increases fat accumulation, especially in the abdominal area
Causes slower metabolism and increased fat storage,Leads to excessive hunger and overeating later

treatment: Garcinia Cambogia - This tropical fruit extract contains hydroxycitric acid (HCA), which helps suppress appetite and inhibit fat production.
Dandelion Tea - Dandelion tea helps reduce water retention and bloating, supporting natural weight loss.
Fenugreek Seeds - Fenugreek seeds reduce food cravings and improve digestion, leading to better weight control.

faqs.question: What is the main cause of obesity?
faqs.answer: Obesity is primarily caused by an imbalance between calorie intake and energy expenditure, but genetic, hormonal, and environmental factors also play a role.

faqs.question: Can obesity be cured naturally?
faqs.answer: Yes, a combination of healthy eating, physical activity, herbal remedies, and lifestyle changes can help manage and reduce obesity.

name: WeightlossSupport
introduction: Weight loss support refers to the use of dietary changes, exercise, lifestyle modifications, and herbal remedies to help individuals lose excess weight in a sustainable and healthy manner. It includes metabolism-boosting foods, appetite control, digestive health improvement, and fat-burning natural herbs that assist in weight management.

symptoms.des: Weight gain or difficulty in losing weight may be associated with various symptoms that indicate the need for weight loss support:
points: Increased body fat percentage (especially around the abdomen)
Slow metabolism (difficulty in losing weight despite efforts)
Uncontrolled food cravings, especially for sugar and carbs
Joint pain or difficulty in movement due to excess weight
Mood swings, stress eating, and emotional overeating

risk_factors: Poor Diet and High-Calorie Intake - Overconsumption of processed foods, sugar, and unhealthy fats, Low intake of fiber, protein, and essential nutrients
Hormonal Imbalances - Thyroid disorders (hypothyroidism) slow metabolism, Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) can contribute to weight gain, Insulin resistance increases fat storage

worse_factors.description: High in sugar, unhealthy fats, and artificial additives that lead to weight gain and poor digestion
Slows metabolism and leads to binge eating later
Lack of water slows digestion and can increase food cravings

treatment: Garcinia Cambogia - This tropical fruit contains hydroxycitric acid (HCA), which suppresses appetite and inhibits fat production.
Fenugreek Seeds -Fenugreek seeds help control food cravings and improve digestion.
Apple Cider Vinegar - Apple cider vinegar helps control appetite, improves digestion, and regulates blood sugar. Drinking a diluted mixture before meals can support weight loss.
Dandelion Tea - Dandelion tea helps with water retention, bloating, and detoxification, supporting natural weight loss.

faqs.question: What is the best natural way to lose weight?
faqs.answer: A combination of healthy eating, regular exercise, hydration, and herbal remedies is the best way to lose weight naturally.

faqs.question: What foods should be avoided for weight loss?
faqs.answer: Avoid processed foods, sugary drinks, refined carbohydrates, and unhealthy fats.

faqs.question: How much exercise is needed for weight loss?
faqs.answer: At least 150-300 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week is recommended for weight loss.

name: EarInfection
introduction: Ear infection or otitis media refers to the infection of the middle ear.
subline: The ear consists of three parts, the external, middle, and internal ear.The external ear consists of the outer, visible part of the ear and some of its parts are in the skull till the tympanic membrane also known as the eardrum. The external ear is connected to the middle ear, which consists of a hollow cavity and some bones which are small in size but are of paramount importance. The middle ear is responsible for the transmission of sound waves from the external ear to the internal ear. The middle ear is connected to the nasopharynx- the part where your nose and throat are in continuity through the eustachian tubes. The middle ear is also connected to the internal ear- which is a complex structure that converts the mechanical signals received from the middle ear into electrical signals that the brain can understand. The inner ear contains bony and membranous structures and plays a major role in maintaining the body's balance.

symptoms.des: The Symptoms and Signs of Ear Infection are
points: Swollen adenoids (Patches of lymphatic tissue at the back of the nose)

risk_factors: Age - Children less than 5 years old are at a higher risk for getting an ear infection.

Bottle-Feeding - Children who are not breastfed are at a higher risk for getting otitis media as breastmilk has antibodies that help fight off infections.
